channel.title: Cache zip file error. This time with many pictures
channel.description:
Hello!
Yesterday i posted a thing about my cache not working. So here i am again, really desperate trying to figure out what's wrong, so i took some screenshots. Which can maybe help me further. Also, i put the singlink and client.java in a dropbox link, hope this helps.
Client: https://www.dropbox.com/s/n0ddhqmklt1njfb/client.java?dl=0
Signlink: https://www.dropbox.com/s/lbmd8yf73vwgqtf/signlink.java?dl=0
Error screenshot: http://imgur.com/nz5c7pt&i60GG2y
Cache screenshot: http://imgur.com/nz5c7pt&i60GG2y#1
Already thanks
Greetz Qeruina

item.title: Cache zip file error. This time with many pictures
item.dc:creator: @qeruina qeruina
item.description:
@qeruina wrote:

Well… the guy that wants to help me is asking for 15 dollars… I do wanna pay that, so sk8rdude, if you wanna help me? Cause i know i can trust you, and i don’t really trust the other guy
Would be really thankfull

Note: just to avoid scamming, i don’t pay if it doesn’t work (sorry if it sounds rude) but i don’t like paying for stuff that doesn’t work

Had 4 people that were ‘‘helping me’’ on teamviewer for 1 hour and afterwards they asked for money even tho it didn’t work

Greetz
Qeruina

Read full topic

item.source: Cache zip file error. This time with many pictures

item.title: Cache zip file error. This time with many pictures
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

The reason you don’t have a cachedownloader class is because this is an older client.
The cachedownloader was something added in more recently with PI.
It’s easy to tell this client is older because the startUp method is still named method6.

You need to change this:

Update u = new Update((new StringBuilder()).append((new StringBuilder()).append("http://www.ballscapepk.org/cache/").append(ZipFileName).toString()).toString(), (new StringBuilder()).append(ZipFileName).toString(), signlink.findcachedir(), false, this);
To a working link.

Read full topic

item.description:

Nope, i don’t have any cachedownloader.java or class, it’s all in the client.java file. Very messy tho

item.source: Cache zip file error. This time with many pictures

item.title: Cache zip file error. This time with many pictures
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

First of all, that is one ugly ass findcachedir(). If you need a cleaner, better one I can supply you with it.

Also looking at your client class, I can see your models are being loaded in the cache, yet looking at the cache your models folder is not present :S.

Do you also have a cachedownloader class or something of the sorts?

Read full topic

But i don’t really use this site anymore since 99% of the people that are willing to help me are being rude and don’t wanna help/ ask money for something that takes 10 minutes. I gave up on the cache since i discovered the guy that gave it changed some stuff in it so i would pay him to fix it. Again a scammer.
I’m very sorry for being rude.

Peace
Qeruina

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

qeruina:

Lol, i know… That’s what i do all the time. But still it doesn’t work, it has to do with the zip file itself.

Then make sure you’re zipping the files properly?
Zip the cache files, not the cache folder

item.source: Cache zip file error. This time with many pictures

item.title: Cache zip file error. This time with many pictures
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

We’ve advanced so much over the years, and yet people are still using completely unrenamed clients…
Based on what has been supplied, your cache link 404s. You need to add a direct link, which means the link should end with “.zip” and when clicked it downloads the zip instantly, it does not take you to a dropbox page.

Read full topic

item.source: Cache zip file error. This time with many pictures

item.title: Cache zip file error. This time with many pictures
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

Never expect or let someone do all the work for you…
Have you changed the Cache name? The Cache path? Link?? Anything like that?
What you could do is, check your Signlink.java & Cachedownloader.java
Make sure everything is okay in there, make sure the path is right, make sure the name is correct, make sure the Link is correct and make sure that you’re zipping it right!
I looked at the screenshots, but I won’t be DL’ing your files, can you paste them in a code format?


If it doesn’t fit, just use pastebin, github or something.
Thx

Read full topic
